page.title: 01Hoy & Rysa little
page.content: This area is on the eastern side of Hoy overlooking Scapa Flow. It is rough moorland a very hilly rising to about 120 metres. Several large burns have cut into the hills forming deep sheltered gullies with a deep covering of heather and shrubs. There are very deep peat bogs here and extensive peat cutting has taken place near the roadside. The only cultivated land in near the shore is Rysa. Just off Hoy is the island of Rysa Little, this is uninhabited and is covered in heather. The waters here are very sheltered and the bays on Hoy are very good for trout fishing.
